bill_title: revise certain provisions regarding abandoned motor vehicles.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide limited immunity to persons that report certain vehicle dealer violations. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 32-6B be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any person acting in good faith is immune from civil liability for filing a report furnishing any information relating to a suspected, anticipated, or completed violation of this chapter by a licensed vehicle dealer to: (1) The Department of Revenue and Regulation; (2) Law enforcement officials; and (3) County officials. If a civil action is commenced against a person for damages related to the filing of a report or the furnishing of information under this section and the court determines that the person acted in good faith in filing the report or furnishing the information, the person filing the report or furnishing the information may recover costs or disbursements under chapter 15-17, including reasonable attorneys fees. If the trier of fact concludes that the person filing the report or furnishing the information was not acting in good faith, the person filing a civil action may recover costs or disbursements under chapter 15-17, including reasonable attorney's fees. This section does not abrogate or modify in any way any common law or statutory privilege or immunity. Section 2. That chapter 32-6C be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any person acting in good faith is immune from civil liability for filing a report furnishing any information relating to a suspected, anticipated, or completed violation of this chapter by a licensed snowmobile dealer to: (1) The Department of Revenue and Regulation; (2) Law enforcement officials; and (3) County officials. If a civil action is commenced against a person for damages related to the filing of a report or the furnishing of information under this section and the court determines that the person acted in good faith in filing the report or furnishing the information, the person filing the report or furnishing the information may recover costs or disbursements under chapter 15-17, including reasonable attorneys fees. If the trier of fact concludes that the person filing the report or furnishing the information was not acting in good faith, the person filing a civil action may recover costs or disbursements under chapter 15-17, including reasonable attorney's fees. This section does not abrogate or modify in any way any common law or statutory privilege or immunity. Section 3. That chapter 32-7A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any person acting in good faith is immune from civil liability for filing a report furnishing any information relating to a suspected, anticipated, or completed violation of this chapter by a licensed dealer to: (1) The Department of Revenue and Regulation; (2) Law enforcement officials; and (3) County officials. If a civil action is commenced against a person for damages related to the filing of a report or the furnishing of information under this section and the court determines that the person acted in good faith in filing the report or furnishing the information, the person filing the report or furnishing the information may recover costs or disbursements under chapter 15-17, including reasonable attorneys fees. If the trier of fact concludes that the person filing the report or furnishing the information was not acting in good faith, the person filing a civil action may recover costs or disbursements under chapter 15-17, including reasonable attorney's fees. This section does not abrogate or modify in any way any common law or statutory privilege or immunity. Section 4. That chapter 32-7B be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any person acting in good faith is immune from civil liability for filing a report furnishing any information relating to a suspected, anticipated, or completed violation of this chapter by a licensed boat dealer to: (1) The Department of Revenue and Regulation; (2) Law enforcement officials; and (3) County officials. If a civil action is commenced against a person for damages related to the filing of a report or the furnishing of information under this section and the court determines that the person acted in good faith in filing the report or furnishing the information, the person filing the report or furnishing the information may recover costs or disbursements under chapter 15-17, including reasonable attorneys fees. If the trier of fact concludes that the person filing the report or furnishing the information was not acting in good faith, the person filing a civil action may recover costs or disbursements under chapter 15-17, including reasonable attorney's fees. This section does not abrogate or modify in any way any common law or statutory privilege or immunity.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions regarding abandoned motor vehicles. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 32-30-12.2 be amended to read as follows: 32-30-12.2. No person shall intentionally may abandon a motor vehicle on any public highway or right-of-way. A violation of this section is a Class 1 Class 2 misdemeanor. Any person convicted of abandoning a motor vehicle shall be ordered to pay a fine of five hundred dollars any reasonable towing and storage fees, if the person was notified pursuant to § 32-36-8 . The court shall suspend the fine if the person pays for the towing and storage expenses. 300 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.029 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
